page.title: 15Thornton Viaduct
page.content: In Thornton stands a viaduct across Pinch Beck valley. It is a local beauty spot. It is not used any more. It is 150 feet high (50 metres) and it has twenty arches. It was built about 1870. The railway was built from Halifax to Bradford and then to Thornton. It was at Thornton that the builders ran out of money when they were going to build the line to Keighley. The viaduct had been too expensive to build. It was many years before the line reached Keighley. The railway line was closed in the 1950's. It stands to show us how the Victorians built things.
